t: Impending Judgment on Israel and Judah
“Hear*pn this, O priests! Take*ld heed, O house of Israel! Give*ld ear, O house of the king! For*ld yours is*i the judgment, Because*ld you have been a snare to Mizpah And*ld a net spread on Tabor.
The*ld revolters are deeply involved in slaughter, Though*ld I rebuke them all.
I*ld know Ephraim, And*ld Israel is not hidden from Me; For*ld now, O Ephraim, you commit harlotry; Israel*ld is defiled.
“They*ln do not direct their deeds Toward*ld turning to their God, For*ld the spirit of harlotry is in their midst, And*ld they do not know the Lord.*s
The*ld pride of Israel testifies to his face; Therefore*ld Israel and Ephraim stumble in their iniquity; Judah*ld also stumbles with them.
“With*ln their flocks and herds They*ld shall go to seek the Lord,*s But*ld they will not find Him;*i He*ld has withdrawn Himself from them.
They*ld have dealt treacherously with the Lord,*s For*ld they have begotten pagan children. Now*ld a New Moon shall devour them and their heritage.
“Blow*ln the ram’s horn in Gibeah, The*ld trumpet in Ramah! Cry*ld aloud at*i Beth Aven, ‘Look*ild behind you, O Benjamin!’
Ephraim*ld shall be desolate in the day of rebuke; Among*ld the tribes of Israel I make known what is sure.
“The*ln princes of Judah are like those who remove a landmark; I*ld will pour out My wrath on them like water.
Ephraim*ld is oppressed and*i broken in judgment, Because*ld he willingly walked by human*i precept.
Therefore*ld I will*i be*i to Ephraim like a moth, And*ld to the house of Judah like rottenness.
“When*ln Ephraim saw his sickness, And*ld Judah saw*i his wound, Then*ld Ephraim went to Assyria And*ld sent to King Jareb; Yet*ld he cannot cure you, Nor*ld heal you of your wound.
For*ld I will*i be*i like a lion to Ephraim, And*ld like a young lion to the house of Judah. I,*ld even*i I, will tear them*i and go away; I*ld will take them*i away, and no one shall rescue.
I*ld will return again to My place Till*ld they acknowledge their offense. Then*ld they will seek My face; In*ld their affliction they will earnestly seek Me.”
